how.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used to ask or talk about the way in which something happens or is done
how.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: How do you spell your name?
I’d like to help in some way, but I’m not sure how.
He explained how the system worked.
We both used to work at the airport – that’s how we met.
advice on how best (=the best way) to invest your money
They had a number of suggestions as to how the service could be improved.
This still leaves the question of how local services should be funded.
How on earth did you find out?
how on earth/in the world etc
I don’t know how to get to your house.
Alan showed me how to load the gun.
how.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used to ask or talk about the amount, size, degree etc of something
how.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: How big is the state of Louisiana?
How many kids do they have now?
How long have you been learning English?
Do you know how old it is?
They couldn’t tell exactly how far away the bridge was.
She wondered how much Angela already knew.
how.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used to ask about someone’s health, especially when you meet them
how.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: ‘Hi Laurie, how are you?’ ‘Fine, thanks. How are you?’
Has Ros had the baby yet? How is she?
how.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: used when you meet someone, to ask for news about their life, work etc
how.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: So how’s it going at work these days? Still enjoying it?
how.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: used to ask someone about their opinion or experience of something
how.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: How do you feel about seeing Peter again?
How’s that? Does that feel comfortable?
how.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: used after certain adjectives or verbs to refer to an event or situation
how.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: It’s amazing how they’ve managed to get everything finished so quickly.
I remember how she always used to have fresh flowers in the house.
how.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: used to emphasize the quality you are mentioning
how.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: ‘John’s been in an accident.’ ‘Oh, how awful!’
I didn’t realize how difficult it was to get tickets.
He was impressed at how well she could read.
how.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: used to say that something happens to a very great degree
how.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with how
You use how before an ordinary adjective
We all know how important exercise is
We all know how much important exercise is
You use how much before a comparative adjective
They realize how much better life is
They realize how better life is
how.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: USAGE: How or what?
You use what with look/feel/be like to ask for or give a description
You use what with think to ask or talk about someone's opinion
What do you think of him?
How do you think of him?
